content.text:
# Yente (18th-century)

Yente (18th century) was a Jewish spiritual Hasidic leader. She wore the tallit.
She was a disciple of Baal Shem Tov, who declared her to be a prophet. She became a figure of pilgrimage, to whom both men and women came and gave gifts in exchange for gifts and blessings.
References
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=ykWQGAJ4_HkC&dq=Anna+the+Hebrew+sforza&pg=PA108 The JPS Guide to Jewish Women: 600 B.C.E.to 1900 C.E.]
